Title: Data Analytics Engineer
Description:
Your New Company

A lot has changed at Frontify over the last decade, but people continue to be at the heart of our vision.

Every day, we empower thousands of brand builders worldwide — including teams at Lufthansa, KIA, Vodafone, and Uber — to create brands that have an impact. Our more than 300 employees collaborate and engage in and around our headquarters in St. Gallen, Switzerland, and offices in London and New York City. And we’re looking for new team members to join us.

We’re built on a collaborative culture of experimentation, trust, and transparency. If you want to help us achieve our mission of creating a home where brands can thrive, read on.

Your team

While small, the Data team is mighty. They provide the information that drive our decisions, build our data culture, and extend our data warehouse. Their work shapes what and how every team in Frontify does what they do best. In their downtime, they’re enjoying the good life – spending time with their families, reading French literature, or tending to their gardens.

Your Mission

As a Data Analytics Engineer, you will drive innovation through proactive data discovery and analysis, uncovering insights that answer questions yet to be asked. Leveraging the full analytical stack, you will deliver high-quality, scalable data solutions. You thrive in collaborative environments, working closely with stakeholders and team members to develop data products, maintain clear data lineage, and ensure alignment through strong communication. Your goal will be to empower decision-making by transforming raw data into actionable intelligence.

Your Responsibilities


You’ll develop and apply data products based on the complete customer journey. With a focus on the product usage of customers.
You’ll partner with various departments such as product marketing to create insights that generate value for our customers, sales team, customer support and product managers.
You understand and translate departmental data needs into practical solutions, acting as a liaison between the raw data and actionable insights.
You’ll engage in hands-on data modeling, working closely with business stakeholders and other members in the central data team to maintain data integrity and adhere to best practices.
You independently manage data projects from concept to completion, aligning them with end-user needs and organizational value.
You’ll gather, organize, and document data requirements with clarity and precision.
You’ll utilize SQL expertise for advanced data modeling tasks, using our technology stack (Fivetran, dbt core, Snowflake, ThoughtSpot, GitHub).



Your Story


You can work remotely from anywhere in Switzerland or on-site in our St. Gallen office – or even mix it up during the week! Choose where to work from that works best for you.
You hold a bachelor's or advanced degree in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Economics, etc.).
You have proven experience leveraging raw data to create insights.
You have a strong background in enriching and integrating data from various sources (e.g., CRM, Subscription management, Consumption, Event level data) to support business needs.
You have experience conducting thorough EDAs to uncover insights and present actionable findings.
You are proficient in advanced analytics techniques, including PCA, cluster analysis, and regression models.
You are able to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including RevOps, FP&A, Marketing, and Subscription Management teams, to generate insights and support KPI management.
You have proficiency in data modeling, SQL and Python or R, with experience in our data technology stack being an added advantage.
You hold experience with version control, ensuring clear data lineage, peer reviews, and alignment across teams.
You speak English fluently.



Why join us?


We want to see you thrive; we’ll provide you the tools to shape your place and future at Frontify.
We have a product that helps to connect brands and people with a human element.
We offer you the chance to enjoy your work, offering flexibility, opportunity, and exposure to new technologies and ideas.
We are a social bunch so if you are an animal lover, a student of yoga, or love travel, we have all the slack channels you need!



What We Offer


We encourage you to take at least 5 weeks of holiday
Budget for home office set-up
Annual salary review
Additional localized benefits
Invite to our annual, summer company meet-up



Important to us

At Frontify, we believe in being true to ourselves: We are committed to creating and fostering an inclusive environment of vibrant individuals whose diverse perspectives build our collective future. We aim to provide equal opportunities and nurture a workplace free of harassment and discrimination.

Next steps


Send us your CV and answer some questions: You’ll hear back from us with updates on your application.
Virtual call with the Recruiter: You'll meet the Talent team to discuss Frontify, the role, and you – your passions, your skills, you.
Virtually meet the team: You'll meet your new team over a few calls. You'll discuss the role, showcase your skills through your answers or a case study (or both), and get a feel for the brand-new journey that's awaiting you.
Join us: If all goes well, you'll join Frontify's journey soon.



We also wanted to let you know that we may run preliminary checks on successful candidates. In the instance we run a preliminary check, it will depend on the role you are applying for and will be done in accordance with the applicable law of the country of employment. We’ll provide you with all the details about the next steps during the interview process

  • Send us your CV and answer some questions: You’ll hear back from us with updates on your application.

  • Join us: If all goes well, you'll join Frontify's journey soon.


We also wanted to let you know that we may run preliminary checks on successful candidates. In the instance we run a preliminary check, it will depend on the role you are applying for and will be done in accordance with the applicable law of the country of employment. We’ll provide you with all the details about the next steps during the interview process

Title: Analytics Engineer
Description:
Who We Are And What We Do

As EF Tours ramps up our digital modernization journey, we are looking for a talented Analytics Engineer to join our dynamic team and help us expand data-driven decision-making within operations. You will join a team of Analytics Engineering professionals helping to provide data warehousing and modelling solutions which support our stakeholders in operations to gain a faster and more accurate insights from our data. The data and insights we deliver has a direct impact on the huge number of students and adults travelling with us, as well as the profitability of the business. We operate from the EF global headquarters in Zurich, Switzerland.

The role

You will work closely and build relationships with data engineers, analysts, data scientists and operations business stakeholders to understand, organize, integrate, clean, test and document our data to provide a well structured data warehouse following medallion architecture principles.


Develop and architect our cloud analytics data warehouse using Snowflake and DBT
Develop and maintain dimensional models using Power BI Semantic and SSAS tabular data models
Develop reports and dashboards in Power BI
Build relationships with key partners and routinely present proposals and results
Gather and share expertise, best practices and insights internally
Partner with cross-functional global teams across engineering and operations to implement data models across the business


Your Profile

You are passionate, smart and thrive in a collaborative environment. Someone who gets excited about working deeply with data and new approaches to enhance the quality and value of the customer experiences we deliver will fit in best with our team.


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-driven and have good communication skills
A team-player with an agile mind-set 
Comfortable in a fast-paced environment
Excellent organizational skills and highly attentive to detail
You have a keen sense of user experience and interfaces


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, Information Technology or equivalent professional experience
2-5 years of experience analytics engineering and/or data engineering experience
2-5 years of work experience with dimensional modeling, ETL/ELT or other relevant data pipeline tools
Highly proficient working in SQL
Expertise in ingesting, transforming, and consolidating data from structured and unstructured data systems suitable for analytics solutions
Proficiency in creating insightful reports/dashboards in Power BI
Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and business stakeholders
A proven team player


Other useful skills include:


Experience with DBT is a great plus
Experience with Snowflake is a great plus
Experience with Git
Experience with SQL Server
Experience with Agile/Scrum/Kanban methodologies
Experience with Prefect
Experience with Salesforce
Enthusiasm to work anywhere in the stack, especially in unfamiliar areas


EF Educational Tours’ operational division is headquartered in the heart of Zurich, in the newly renovated office by the river Sihl. We offer a wide range of benefits ready for our full time staff including:


Hybrid work model 
Full reimbursement of the SBB ‘halb-tax’ travel card, covering country-wide public transportation
Discounted passes to local destinations and tourist hot-spots such as mt. Titlis or Kunsthaus Zurich 
Tuition reimbursement of 1500 CHF for professional development once per year 
Participation in our Staff Travel Experience Program once a year including travel on one of our tours 
Yearly kick off conference around the world
Free membership for our newly built gym or get involved with our variety of sports teams
  Seasonal and monthly office events including holiday parties, ski trips and pay-day happy hours
  Discounts on a wide range of local restaurants, shops, hotel stays and EF products
  15% off in-house childcare service 
Discounts on EF & Hult products for staff and family members


About EF Education First

At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, caste, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://www.ef.com.
Show more

  • Experience with Salesforce
  • Enthusiasm to work anywhere in the stack, especially in unfamiliar areas

EF Educational Tours’ operational division is headquartered in the heart of Zurich, in the newly renovated office by the river Sihl. We offer a wide range of benefits ready for our full time staff including:

  • Hybrid work model 
  • Full reimbursement of the SBB ‘halb-tax’ travel card, covering country-wide public transportation
  • Discounted passes to local destinations and tourist hot-spots such as mt. Titlis or Kunsthaus Zurich 
  • Tuition reimbursement of 1500 CHF for professional development once per year 
  • Participation in our Staff Travel Experience Program once a year including travel on one of our tours 
  • Yearly kick off conference around the world
  • Free membership for our newly built gym or get involved with our variety of sports teams
  •   Seasonal and monthly office events including holiday parties, ski trips and pay-day happy hours
  •   Discounts on a wide range of local restaurants, shops, hotel stays and EF products
  •   15% off in-house childcare service 
  • Discounts on EF & Hult products for staff and family members

About EF Education First

At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities.

When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across more than 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education. Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender, age, religion, caste, parental status, identity, experience and everything else that makes you unique.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://www.ef.com.

Title: IT System Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Als IT System Engineer bist du verantwortlich für die Planung, Umsetzung und Betreuung moderner IT-Infrastrukturen. Du bist die zentrale Anlaufstelle für technische Lösungen, analysierst Anforderungen unserer Kunden und entwickelst innovative Konzepte – von Cloud-Lösungen bis hin zu Modern Workplace-Strategien. Gemeinsam mit deinem Team stellst du sicher, dass unsere Kunden effizient und zukunftssicher arbeiten können. Dein Ziel ist es, zuverlässige IT-Umgebungen zu schaffen und durch dein Know-how langfristige Kundenbeziehungen zu stärken. 




Arbeitsort: Sirnach | Stellenprozent: 80-100% | Arbeitsbeginn: nach Vereinbarung




Deine Aufgaben

Analyse der Anforderung unserer Kunden und Konzeptgestaltung für IT-Lösungen 
Implementation von Lösungen, wie beispielsweise Modern Workplace-Konzepte, zur Optimierung der digitalen Zusammenarbeit 
Umsetzung der erarbeiteten Lösungen, eigenständig oder gemeinsam im Team 
Kommunikation und Organisation kleinerer Projekte direkt mit unseren Kunden 
Unterstützung des Bereich Helpdesk und Bearbeitung von Support-Tickets 
Vor-Ort-Supporteinsätze bei unseren Kunden 
Gelegentliche Unterstützung bei der Erstellung von Angeboten für unsere Kunden




Dein Profil

Abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder Weiterbildung im Bereich Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Qualifikation 
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Microsoft-Umfeld, insbesondere Microsoft 365, Windows 10/11 und Active Directory, sowie Erfahrung mit VMware (vSphere) und Veeam 
Begeisterung für Technik und neue Technologien 
Selbstständige, motivierte, offene, agile und zuverlässige Arbeitsweise 
Kunden- und teamorientiertes Handeln kombiniert mit hoher Eigenverantwortung 
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowohl am Telefon als auch per E-Mail 
Sichere Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift




Wir bieten

Profitiere von Unterstützung und Möglichkeiten zur Weiterbildung, um deine Fähigkeiten kontinuierlich zu erweitern und beruflich zu wachsen
Arbeite an modernen Arbeitsplätzen und geniesse flexible Jahres-Arbeitszeiten
freiwilliges Mittwoch Jogging oder Freitag CrossFit
Profitiere von attraktiven Vergünstigungen
Zweimal wöchentlich besteht die Möglichkeit zur Verpflegung in unserer Cafeteria durch das House Catering
Diverse Firmenanlässe




Bewerbung

Sende uns deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen an recruiting@rey-technology.com.

Show more

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
Position Overview

Analysis and design of technological solutions based on business requirements and processes, as well as on knowledge of existing and future platforms. You will be part of Avaloq Europe Platform Services team and will regularly work with business stakeholders in the elaboration of functional requirements and with development teams for their technical implementation.

You have the drive and the ability to understand the business processes and has in-depth knowledge of Avaloq core banking system (ideally also the respective Deutsche Bank customization and connected satellite systems) and can transform this knowledge into functional solutions and processes that create value and enable our business.

You will be responsible for:


Defining detailed business requirements with business stakeholders
Reviewing solution proposals and specifications from Avaloq as a vendor
Supporting the implementation teams in design phase to ensure that the implementation fulfils business requirements and solutions are consistent with potential evolution
Cooperation with Business Architecture and Solution Architecture teams to ensure that solutions are in line with target architecture and technical roadmap
Hands-on test execution and test support for expert users
Close interaction and alignment with various business areas to ensure that all the requirements are fulfilled in all the solutions implemented
Strive for simplicity in designs and solutions
Act as a go-to person which business stakeholders can reach out for receiving subject matter expert advice, guidance and training
Close cooperation with the Center of Competence for driving test automation forward and engage the respective SMEs for reviewing effort estimations and detailed solution designs



Position Specific Responsibilities And Accountabilities

You will be responsible for the adequacy of the proposed solutions (from its definition to its implementation) in collaboration with business and technical teams.

People Management

You will be integrated into Avaloq Europe Platform Services team where it will be necessary to coordinate multidisciplinary teams and manage collaboration with Avaloq as a vendor and other 3rd parties.

Experience

5+ years of experience in functional analysis in area of Private Banking, Wealth Management.

Education/ Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Computing or similar.
Master recommended
Strongly familiar with Avaloq Core Platform; Avaloq certification is a plus
Experience in project management and knowledge about the entire application development life cycle (planning, budget, approval, sourcing, monitoring and implementation) including Agile methodology
Leadership and communication skills
Ability to identify risks, resolve conflicts and plan tasks
Self-motivated and flexibility to work autonomously coupled with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/global organizations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing.
Organized self-starter able to manage in a complex environment
A team player who continually collaborates and shares information
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Experience in JIRA, Confluence and HP ALM will be a plus
English proficiency required



We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Title: System Engineer
Description:
Dich auf eine Sache zu spezialisieren klingt für dich langweilig?




Als System Engineer kannst du dich hier als Generalist in der Hybrid-Cloud beweisen und hast jeden Tag Abwechslung.




In dieser hoch-modernen, öffentlichen Verwaltung im Osten des Kantons arbeitest du mit Themen von VMware über VEEAM bis hin zu Azure und M365. Auch Themen wie Netzwerk und Security dürfen dich nicht abschrecken.




Anforderungen:




Mind. 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Systemtechnik
Breites Skillset und Bereitschaft als Generalist zu arbeiten
Kollaboratives Mindset - Enge Zusammenarbeit im Team
Deutsch auf mind. C1 Level




Was dich erwartet:




Hybrides Arbeiten
Flexible Arbeitszeiten (Jahresarbeitszeit - keine Service- oder Pikettzeiten)
Enger Austausch im Team mit agilen Projekten
Bis zu 120'000 CHF Vergütung







Wenn du Fragen hast, melde dich gerne unter viktor@alpinerea.ch oder direkt hier bei LinkedIn.

Show more

Title: Business Analyst IT
Description:
Itecor est une société internationale de conseil en transformation digitale dont le siège est situé en Suisse. Nos consultants relèvent au quotidien le défi de travailler sur des projets pour de prestigieux clients issus aussi bien des secteurs technologiques, bancaires et financiers que du secteur public, de l'enseignement et des produits de grande consommation. Grâce à nos communautés de pratique, nous les accompagnons pour devenir les meilleurs dans leur domaine. Être proche de nos clients, fournir des services à haute valeur ajoutée, incarner l'innovation appliquée - ensemble avec nos consultants : voilà ce qui fait notre ADN. S'il est important pour vous de travailler pour une entreprise attachée au respect, à la qualité et au service, avec une approche tournée vers l'humain, consciente de sa responsabilité sociale, nous aimerions faire votre connaissance : rejoignez une communauté qui valorise le savoir, qui fait preuve d'audace et qui vous inspirera.

Pour renforcer notre équipe d'experts en solutions digitales à Lausanne nous recrutons un(e)


Business Analyst



Si vous êtes passionné par la business analyse, que vous cherchez constamment à apprendre et à enrichir vos compétences, alors vous êtes celui/celle que nous recherchons ! Vous ferez partie de notre équipe d'experts et serez impliqué dans des projets ambitieux.







votre rôle


En collaboration avec le chef de projet, assurer la mise en œuvre d'une solution pour un service bénéficiaire.
Décrire le périmètre fonctionnel et non fonctionnel matérialisé par le référentiel d'exigences, le cahier des charges et les spécifications.
Accompagner les services bénéficiaires dans la description et la priorisation des exigences.
Assurer la traçabilité du besoin à l'exigence et de l'exigence à la fonctionnalité.
Escalader au chef de projet les écarts si nécessaires, pour faire évoluer les besoins et la solution itérativement dans une démarche agile.
Décrire une solution viable qui tienne compte du cadre et des directives/concepts en vigueur : architecture, sécurité, produits et services, cyberadministration, archivage, protection des données, tests, etc... Intégrer les compétences associées à la relecture des exigences, du cahier des charges et des spécifications.
En collaboration avec les utilisateurs, élaborer les cas d'usage et les maquettes fonctionnelles.
Favoriser l'analyse de l'expérience utilisateur.
Rédiger des livrables tel que le dossier d'exigences, le cahier des charges, les spécifications générales et détaillées, les processus détaillés, user stories, maquettes, acceptation de la solution, stratégie de changement, stratégie de tests, bilan de projet.
Soutenir le chef de projet dans ses activités de pilotage, d'analyse prospective des risques et d'accompagnement au changement.
Soutenir le Responsable du SI dans la description de l'architecture fonctionnelle et les processus du SI.
Soutenir l'équipe qualité et tests dans la définition et la réalisation de scénarios et tests fonctionnels ainsi que leur acceptation par le métier.



vos connaissances


Bachelor en Informatique ou équivalent.
Certification en Business Analyst, IIBA, IREB ou équivalent souhaitée.
Minimum 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Business Analyst.
Expérience de conception de solution et du cycle de vie du logiciel.
Pratique des concepts et méthodologies agiles.
ce que nous offrons


Faire partie d'une entreprise multinationale et diversifiée ayant des bureaux en Suisse, en France, en Macédoine, au Mexique et en Espagne.
Bénéficier de notre gestion des connaissances grâce à un large éventail de compétences et de conseils.
Se développer sur le plan personnel et professionnel
Bénéficier d'un environnement de travail convivial et respectueux
Profiter d'événements internes réguliers et divertissants pour favoriser les échanges
Oser être soi-même, faire preuve d'engagement personnel et de responsabilité, obtenir un respect mutuel, une ouverture d'esprit et des souvenirs inoubliables.
Parrainer de nouveaux employés et être récompensé

itecor, trusted advisor for your digital transformation

Itecor est une entreprise indépendante et solide qui s'est développée dans le respect de ses valeurs humaines et sociétales depuis sa création en 1992. Aujourd'hui, Itecor International SA emploie plus de 220 collaborateurs dans 8 bureaux différents à travers le monde (Vevey, Genève, Zurich, Paris, Barcelone, Skopje, Mexico, Durango), et propose des services basés sur les trois piliers que sont la gouvernance et la gestion de services, les solutions digitales et l'assurance qualité-testing. Des équipes locales et transversales tissent des liens de qualité, durables, avec leurs clients.

Nous nous réjouissons de votre candidature.

Nous vous informons que seuls les candidats sélectionnés recevront une réponse. Nous vous remercions de votre compréhension.

  • Expérience de conception de solution et du cycle de vie du logiciel.

  • Se développer sur le plan personnel et professionnel
  • Bénéficier d'un environnement de travail convivial et respectueux
  • Profiter d'événements internes réguliers et divertissants pour favoriser les échanges
  • Oser être soi-même, faire preuve d'engagement personnel et de responsabilité, obtenir un respect mutuel, une ouverture d'esprit et des souvenirs inoubliables.
  • Parrainer de nouveaux employés et être récompensé

Title: System Engineer
Description:
Für einen unserer Kunden suchen wir einen System Engineer Junior/Senior in Rothenburg, Schweiz.




Deine Aufgaben:

Nach einer systematischen Einführung erwarten dich spannende und vielseitige Tätigkeiten, die du entweder bei den Kunden vor Ort oder am Standort in Rothenburg ausführst:

Wartung und Betreuung der Systemplattformen unserer Kunden in der deutschsprachigen Schweiz.
Konfiguration und Betreuung von Netzwerken, Servern und Clients.
Konfiguration und Management von Microsoft-Produkten.
Bearbeitung von Ereignissen aus der Plattformüberwachung.
Beantwortung und Lösung von Anfragen im Bereich Systemtechnik.
Dokumentation der Systemplattformen.

Auf Senior-Level (je nach Erfahrung) übernimmst du zusätzlich die Verantwortung für Kundenprojekte und/oder spezifische Expertenthemen.




Dein Profil:

Um erfolgreich in dieser Rolle zu starten, bringst du Folgendes mit:

Eine fundierte Ausbildung im Bereich Informatik.
Eine strukturierte, vorausschauende und zuverlässige Arbeitsweise.
Bereitschaft zu flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und Pikettdiensten.
Führerausweis der Kategorie B.
Für die Senior-Position: mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Tätigkeit.




Das wird dir geboten:

Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Jahresarbeitszeitmodelle und die Möglichkeit zu Sabbaticals.
Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz mit bester Ausstattung.
Wertvolle Weiterbildungsangebote und individuelle Karriereoptionen, sowohl fachlich als auch in Richtung Führung.

Show more

  • Für die Senior-Position: mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Tätigkeit.


Das wird dir geboten:

  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Jahresarbeitszeitmodelle und die Möglichkeit zu Sabbaticals.
  • Einen modernen Arbeitsplatz mit bester Ausstattung.
  • Wertvolle Weiterbildungsangebote und individuelle Karriereoptionen, sowohl fachlich als auch in Richtung Führung.

Title: Analyste Données Exploitation
Description:
Description du poste :

Votre missionRattaché·e au bureau d’Exploitation, vous êtes en charge d’assurer la qualité et la pertinence des données de l’Exploitation en conformité avec le contrat de prestations et la politique des transports de l’Etat. 

Vos principales responsabilités

Assurer le suivi et la validation des données (comptages des passagers, kilomètres, heures, etc.),
participer à l’analyse des données et identifier les écarts par rapport aux valeurs théoriques,
produire les rapports périodiques et analyser les résultats par rapport aux objectifs,
gérer l’outil Smartcockpit et alerter sur les écarts constatés,
suivre les programmes d’accompagnement des élèves conducteurs et les échéances des examens OFT,
suivre les primes pour les futur∙e∙s conducteurs∙trices de tramway en formation,
gérer les mouvements du personnel et réaliser toutes les modifications nécessaires (casier, boîte aux lettres, etc.),
gérer le temps pour le personnel administratif de l’Exploitation dans SAP et gérer le processus de postulation lors de la mise au concours des roulements,
participer à la définition des règles de collecte des données et à la mise en place des tableaux de bord.

Votre profil 

5 ans d’expériences professionnelles dans le domaine de la mobilité,
CFC ou diplôme équivalent, 
maîtrise des outils de gestion des données et des logiciels associés (Smartcockpit, Excel,…),
connaissance du logiciel SAP souhaité,
compétences en analyse de données et en production de rapports,
excellente capacité d’organisation et de coordination interne,
capacité à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe,
sens des responsabilités, d’initiative, et d’organisation, avec une grande précision dans votre travail,
rigueur, réactivité et capacité à résoudre des problèmes,
maîtrise de langue française tant à l’oral qu’à l’écrit.

Êtes-vous intéressé∙e ?  Si vous êtes intéressé·e par cette belle opportunité professionnelle et que vous répondez aux exigences telles que définies, vous êtes invité·e à nous adresser votre dossier de candidature complet.Sensibles au développement durable, nous vous informons que seuls les dossiers complets reçus à l’adresse https://www.tpg.ch/fr/carriere seront pris en considération et recevront une réponse de notre part.

Title: Data Engineer Energie (w/m)
Description:
Data Engineer Energie (w/m)
 
80-100%

Freue dich auf spannende Aufgaben:

Die Verantwortung für die Entwicklung und Bewirtschaftung des Dateninformationssystems für unsere Kraftwerke, wie Kehrichtverwertungsanalagen oder Holzkraftwerke, übernehmen.
Energiedaten analysieren, visualisieren und Handlungsempfehlungen ableiten.
Dem Betrieb, dem Engineering und externen Behörden, Energiebilanzen, Produktions- und Lastprognosen sowie Dashboards zur Verfügung stellen.
Bei Studien für die langfristige Entwicklung des Anlageparks mitarbeiten.
Eine einwandfreie Datenqualität sicherstellen und Sicherheitsrisiken minimieren.

 
Damit machst du uns noch besser:

Du glänzt mit deinen Skills im Data-Engineering – Erfahrungen mit Energiedaten bringen dich weiter.
Dein Ausbildungsrucksack ist gefüllt mit einem Studium auf Stufe FH in Data Engineering, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Maschinenbau, Verfahrenstechnik o.Ä.
Idealerweise bringst du erste Erfahrungen im Programmieren mit.
Du bist kommunikationsstark auf allen Flughöhen und es fällt dir leicht, auch komplexe Informationen einfach zu übermitteln.
Du schätzt die Abwechslung – es macht dir nichts aus an zwei Standorten (Hauptsitz und Kehrrichtverwertungsanlage) tätig zu sein.


Davon profitierst du:

Aufbruchsstimmung und viel frischem Wind in der ganzen IWB.

Top-Sozialleistungen – wir denken jetzt schon an deine Vorsorge.

Für die Zukunft haben wir viel vor, das macht deinen Job sicher.

Hallo Mensch! Wir sind erfrischend unkompliziert und du triffst bei uns auf sympathische Menschen – lerne sie hier kennen.

Wir haben noch viel mehr zu bieten, schau einfach mal hier vorbei.
 
Bei Fragen für dich da

Eva Berse, HR Business Partner, 0612755131, eva.berse@iwb.ch

Alles klar?

Wunderbar, dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung! Das Motivationsschreiben ist optional.
Wenn du zuerst noch ein paar Fragen hast, her damit. Andreas Peter ist vielleicht schon bald dein Chef und unter +41 61 275 55 15 gerne für dich da.

Toll, dass du dich für diese Stelle interessierst. Bitte bewirb dich online unter www.karriere.iwb.ch und los geht's. Wir freuen uns, mehr über dich zu erfahren.

Title: Biostatistics Intern
Description:
Description: Biostatistics Intern 2025

Start Date: Summer 2025

Duration: 3-4 months

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/. 

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for Statistics & Decision Sciences (SDS) Summer Interns across multiple European locations. These internships are available for undergraduate and graduate students working towards a degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related Quantitative discipline. There are up to 10 positions available. Students will have the opportunity to work with practicing statisticians and computing science specialists and to learn about practical, applied statistical needs and solutions specific to clinical or nonclinical pharmaceutical industry settings. Our teams benefit from the student's academic training and in turn contribute to the further professional development of the student as well as have a first-hand opportunity to evaluate the student's potential for future employment.

In this role, students will be involved in activities such as:


Supporting Research and Development in areas that range from Drug Discovery through Phase 2 and 3 clinical studies
Pharmaceutical Manufacturing
Data preparation
Graphical exploration of data
Statistical model building and analyses
Report writing
Writing of computer programs or software applications associated with the statistical analyses.


Other activities may include:


Designing experiments
Conducting simulations to evaluate optimal designs
Participation in methodological development.


Qualifications:


Successful candidates must, by the start of their employment, have permission to work unrestricted in the country to which they are applying
Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited university pursuing the following degrees: Biostatistics, Statistics, or a related Quantitative discipline.
Candidates must be available to work full-time for 12 weeks from June 2025.
Demonstrated leadership is preferred.
Proficiency in R is preferred.
Candidates must be detail-oriented, highly organized and able to manage multiple tasks.
Candidates must have the ability to work individually (independently) as well as on a team.
Participation in campus/community service activities is desired.


For more than 130 years, diversity, equity & inclusion (DEI) has been a part of our cultural fabric at Johnson & Johnson and woven into how we do business every day. Rooted in Our Credo, the values of DEI fuel our pursuit to create a healthier, more equitable world. Our diverse workforce and culture of belonging accelerate innovation to solve the world’s most pressing healthcare challenges.

We know that the success of our business – and our ability to deliver meaningful solutions – depends on how well we understand and meet the diverse needs of the communities we serve. Which is why we foster a culture of inclusion and belonging where all perspectives, abilities and experiences are valued and our people can reach their potential.

At Johnson & Johnson, we all belong.

#JNJEMEAStudentCareers #JNJEMEAInternship

Title: Business Planning Analyst
Description:
What To Expect
The Business Planning Analyst is responsible for driving the overall performance of our Sales & Delivery organization, which includes defining the key strategies and designing sales programs to solve for the objectives of the sales team. As part of this team, you will develop in-depth knowledge of market dynamics and demand drivers across EMEA to define cohesive business plans to achieve short and long-term objectives. You will have the opportunity to utilize your skills in quantitative analysis, project management, thought leadership and problem-solving to define programmatic solutions to support demand generation and sales process efficiencies.

What we offer:

You will have the opportunity to develop and continuously improve the way we project demand and resource requirements across the various vehicle markets. You will work with the field teams and headquarter functions to define headcount, location, and vehicles requirements that are in alignment with business objectives during a period of rapid growth. You will be instrumental in building the Business Planning function into a competency center and partner with various teams across the business to develop Tesla’s forecasting and planning capabilities and processes.

This role requires frequent interaction with all our EMEA HQ and market leaders, and you will work closely with the EMEA business analytics and finance teams to identify tactical performance improvement opportunities and improve margin and profitability.

What You'll Do


Develop a deep understanding of market dynamics and demand drivers across the EMEA markets from both analytical and on-the-ground perspectives
Conduct forecast gap analysis and analyze current and past trends in key performance indicators to improve demand and supply projections
Lead ongoing analysis of business performance to support daily operations and develop tailored strategies, tactical measures, and sales programs to drive improvements and support demand generation
Analyze internal and external sales data to identify opportunities/risks, while working closely with teams in the field across EMEA to understand local market dynamics and ensure our planning process and model incorporates market differences
Own aspects of the planning process, including resource planning and allocation, sales strategy, logistics planning and business priorities, while managing communication with various cross-functional teams to develop cohesive plans and achieve business goals
Identify and execute on areas for improvement across the planning process between various teams (sales, delivery, finance, real estate, market readiness, etc.) on our planning, processes, and execution
Provide thought leadership on how we can improve our sales processes, measure performance, and drive efficiency in operations while collaborating closely with the Business Analytics team to define improvements to performance management tools



What You'll Bring


MSc’s degree in Engineering, Computer and/or Data Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Business/Supply Chain Management or equivalent experience and evidence of exceptional ability
Experience in with SQL, Python and/or other programming languages (e.g. Matlab) to build operational models
Proven experience in data processing methods (e.g. building ETLs) with strong knowledge of Excel data processing and automation and solid experience in BI visualization and dashboarding (e.g. Tableau)
Good understanding of S&OP (Sales & Operations Planning) elements and process. Experienced in driving cross-functional initiatives and process improvements
High level of data quality and integrity and a proven track record in delivering change, process improvement, and root cause analytics
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to travel domestically and internationally as required



, Tesla

Title: Functional Analysis Chief Specialist
Description:
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.

Write the next chapter of your ABB story.

This position reports to

IS Service Owner

Your role and responsibilities

In this role, you will have the opportunity to bridge the gap between the technical environment and the business. Each day, you will use data analytics to assess processes and outline problems, opportunities, and solutions, to support decisions for new or changed Information Systems (IS) solutions or services. You will also showcase your expertise by supporting constantly in the continual service improvement process.

The work model for the role is#Onsite

This role is contributing to the IS Services globally.

You will be mainly accountable for:


Serve as a dedicated Analyst for in-house and Vendor developed Treasury applications
Collaborate with Treasury Business Stakeholders, Operations Managers, Service Owners, and Vendors’ representatives to understand needs and estimate the effort for IT solution development, change requests, and releases
Gain a detailed understanding of business processes and apply the knowledge to shape and align IT solutions development
Document business needs in comprehensively, translating the requirements for development teams
Act as Subject Matter Expert (SME) in your area of responsibility, providing technical and business process/data expertise to support of ongoing operations or software development
Operate within a Scrum/Agile environment
Play a key analytical role in projects including taking on the Product Owner role



Qualifications For The Role


Master’s degree in computer science, Economics, Finance or equivalent level of knowledge
Experience in global IT projects
Minimum 5 years of experience with the software development lifecycle
Scrum or general Agile knowledge and experience
Treasury or Corporate Finance processes knowledge is a strong advantage
Financial knowledge (especially Treasury solutions experience), knowledge of SAP solutions is a plus
Fluency in English is essential
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills


More about us

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

Our mission in ABB IS (Information Systems) is to harness the power of information technology to deliver valuable, reliable, and competitive IS services for ABB. If you have a strong technical skills, analytical mind, and the drive to help us stay ahead of the competition, you are the one we are looking for.

It has come to our attention that the name of ABB is being used for asking candidates to make payments for job opportunities (interviews, offers). Please be advised that ABB makes no such requests. All our open positions are made available on our career portal for all fitting the criteria to apply.

ABB does not charge any fee whatsoever for recruitment process. Please do not make payments to any individuals / entities in connection to recruitment with ABB, even if is claimed that the money is refundable. ABB is not liable for such transactions.

For current open positions you can visit our career website https://global.abb/group/en/careers and apply. Please refer to detailed recruitment fraud caution notice using the link https://global.abb/group/en/careers/how-to-apply/fraud-warning

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
Description:
Adecco Italia S.p.A., per multinazionale cliente operante nel settore della mobilità, ricerca:




JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La risorsa sarà inserita all’interno della divisione Marketing e Business Development in un contesto fortemente dinamico ed orientato all’analisi dei dati.




Principali attività




Creazione e gestione di report per le diverse direzioni aziendali
Monitoraggio dei KPI aziendali
Supporto per elaborazione di bdgt e forecast
Analisi dati per fini analitici, predittivi e strategici
Gestione di comitati interni
Elaborazione di presentazioni strategiche




Requisiti




Laurea in Matematica/Statistica, discipline economiche
Gradita esperienza pregressa in contesti aziendali automotive, su progetti di Datawarehouse e di Business Intelligence con avanzato uso di strumenti di analisi dati e reporting
Gradita esperienza nella realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Intelligence e Analytics (Report, Dashboard, Data Modeling)
Conoscenza di DB relazionali con utilizzo di join complesse tra tabelle, costruzioni di query attraverso l’utilizzo del linguaggio SQL
Attività di analisi con applicativi quali SAS (es guide o SAS Base)
Gradita conoscenza di QLIKsense come strumento di reporting
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e del pacchetto Office (Power point, Access, Word)
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
Buone capacità relazionali e comunicative con una spiccata capacità di lavorare in team




Sede: Roma.

Contratto: iniziale contratto di somministrazione a tempo determinato semestrale. Ral 32K. Buoni pasto.







I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l’informativa sulla privacy.

Facsimile di domanda disponibile al seguente link Facsimile domanda candidatura.

ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa al seguente link.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Show more
HTML:
Adecco Italia S.p.A., per multinazionale cliente operante nel settore della mobilità, ricerca:


JUNIOR DATA ANALYST


La risorsa sarà inserita all’interno della divisione Marketing e Business Development in un contesto fortemente dinamico ed orientato all’analisi dei dati.


Principali attività


  • Creazione e gestione di report per le diverse direzioni aziendali
  • Monitoraggio dei KPI aziendali
  • Supporto per elaborazione di bdgt e forecast
  • Analisi dati per fini analitici, predittivi e strategici
  • Gestione di comitati interni
  • Elaborazione di presentazioni strategiche


Requisiti


  • Laurea in Matematica/Statistica, discipline economiche
  • Gradita esperienza pregressa in contesti aziendali automotive, su progetti di Datawarehouse e di Business Intelligence con avanzato uso di strumenti di analisi dati e reporting
  • Gradita esperienza nella realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Intelligence e Analytics (Report, Dashboard, Data Modeling)
  • Conoscenza di DB relazionali con utilizzo di join complesse tra tabelle, costruzioni di query attraverso l’utilizzo del linguaggio SQL
  • Attività di analisi con applicativi quali SAS (es guide o SAS Base)
  • Gradita conoscenza di QLIKsense come strumento di reporting
  • Ottima conoscenza di Excel e del pacchetto Office (Power point, Access, Word)
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
  • Buone capacità relazionali e comunicative con una spiccata capacità di lavorare in team


Sede: Roma.

Contratto: iniziale contratto di somministrazione a tempo determinato semestrale. Ral 32K. Buoni pasto.



I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l’informativa sulla privacy.

Facsimile di domanda disponibile al seguente link Facsimile domanda candidatura.

ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa al seguente link.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
In Numia facciamo dell'innovazione e della digitalizzazione dei pagamenti il nostro core business, offrendo alle banche prodotti e servizi di monetica ad alto potenziale innovativo.


Grazie alla sinergia tra le diverse componenti funzionali e tecnologiche, offriamo una risposta tempestiva ai mutamenti di mercato ed alle esigenze della clientela con soluzioni tecnologiche all’avanguardia.


Siamo una IMEL (Istituto di Monetica Elettronica) che conta circa 8 milioni di carte di pagamento e 400.000 POS.


Per l'Unità Organizzativa Fraud Prevention & Analytics, siamo alla ricerca di Data Analyst per il nostro team di Roma.


Entrerai a far parte di un contesto in espansione e continua evoluzione e, tra le principali attività, potrai:

  • Curare l'analisi di grandi set di dati e la relativa reportistica;
  • Supportare lo sviluppo di modelli predittivi per la prevenzione delle frodi;
  • Comprendere le esigenze dei diversi team aziendali al fine di fornire soluzioni data-driven.


Se il progetto ti appassiona e hai i seguenti requisiti, Join Us!

  • Esperienza, anche breve, in ruoli di Data Analysis;
  • Buona conoscenza di SQL;
  • Esperienza nell’uso di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Power BI;
  • Conoscenza di Python per l’analisi dati;
  • Familiarità con strumenti di Data Wrangling e pulizia dei dati;
  • Capacità di presentare i dati in modo chiaro e intuitivo attraverso dashboard e report;
  • Conoscenza base degli aspetti operativi e sistemistici di macchine Linux.


Unendoti al Team Numia troverai:

  • Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e positivo, dove la tua opinione è importante e vogliamo che tu la esprima
  • Colleghi competenti e collaborativi, con i quali potrai sempre confrontarti e mettere a fattor comune le reciproche conoscenze e capacità
  • Possibilità di esprimere il tuo talento in un contesto in forte crescita e orientato all’innovazione


Ti abbiamo incuriosit*? Se possiedi buone doti relazionali e comunicative, inviaci la tua candidatura all’indirizzo mail selezione@numia.com.


Prima di candidarti, leggi attentamente la nostra informativa sulla privacy https://www.numia.com/Pagine/Utility/Privacy.aspx


Il presente annuncio è rivolto a entrambi i sessi, nel rispetto dei D.Lgs. 98/2006 e 151/2015, e a persone di ogni età e nazionalità, razza e origine etnica, orientamento sessuale, disabilità, religione o stato civile, nel rispetto dei D.Lgs. n. 215/2003 e 216/2003.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Unisciti a Bravo e fai la differenza nella vita delle persone! 🚀

Siamo Bravo, leader nel settore finanziario da 15 anni, specializzati nel fornire soluzioni su misura per aiutare chi si trova in difficoltà economica a ritrovare la propria libertà finanziaria. Operiamo in sei Paesi - Messico, Colombia, Spagna, Italia, Portogallo e Brasile 🗺️ - e siamo in costante espansione.

Ogni giorno, ci impegniamo a trasformare la vita dei nostri clienti. Vuoi fare la differenza con noi?




Stiamo cercando due Data Analyst per unirsi al nostro team e contribuire al successo dei nostri clienti.




🎯 Il tuo ruolo:




Analizzare e monitorare le performance dei clienti nel nostro programma personalizzato, identificando modelli e aree di miglioramento
Elaborare report periodici utilizzando Excel/Google Sheets, con dati precisi e dettagliati che facilitino il processo decisionale
Sviluppare presentazioni in PowerPoint per comunicare risultati e raccomandazioni al team operativo e ad altri dipartimenti chiave
Risolvere problemi operativi e di dati, proponendo soluzioni basate su analisi dettagliate
Applicare concetti finanziari di base per comprendere il comportamento dei clienti e l'impatto delle nostre strategie




🤓 Il tuo profilo:




Esperienza: Almeno 1 anno di esperienza come Data Analyst o in un ruolo simile
Competenze Analitiche: Capacità di interpretare e analizzare grandi volumi di dati, identificare tendenze e generare insights utili
Competenze Tecniche: Padronanza avanzata di Excel/Google Sheets e PowerPoint
Problem Solving: Abilità nell'affrontare problemi complessi in modo strutturato ed efficiente
Conoscenze Finanziarie: Comprensione di concetti finanziari di base.
Disponibilità Immediata: Capacità di unirsi al team immediatamente
Laurea preferibile: Economia, Finanza, Amministrazione




📝 La nostra offerta:




Opportunità di crescita all'interno di un'azienda in espansione
Un ambiente di lavoro dinamico e collaborativo
Possibilità di contribuire in modo significativo al successo dei nostri clienti e all'impatto positivo sulle loro vite finanziarie
Visibilità diretta con i manager e il country manager
Contratto cococo iniziale di 6 mesi + rinnovo con CCNL
Retribuzione fissa pari a 1.413€/lordi + Bonus mensili
Buoni pasto fino a 92€/mensili
Formazione iniziale e successivo affiancamento
Orario full time, presenziale presso il nostro ufficio. Roma, zona Flaminio.




Se vuoi contribuire a una rivoluzione finanziaria, 💪🏻 questa è la tua occasione!

Candidati subito oppure invia la tua candidatura a attrazione@gobravo.it

Scopri di più su di noi visitando il sito bravofinance.it




Bravo: Innoviamo il futuro finanziario. Vuoi essere parte del cambiamento? 💜




La ricerca è rivolta ai candidati di ambo i sessi ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
ATON IT eroga consulenza altamente qualificata in ambito ICT.




Siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst che avrà l’opportunità di partecipare ad un progetto con lunga visibilità per un nostro strategico cliente.




Il contratto, il livello e la retribuzione saranno definiti in fase di colloquio. Accettiamo candidature di consulenti interessati a lavorare a Partita Iva.




Competenze del candidato:




Pentaho (sia modulo di ETL Data Integration che modulo di Reporting\Interactive Report)




Completano il profilo:

Laurea e/o Diploma in discipline tecnico-scientifiche,
buona conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata.




Sede: Milano e Roma, con possibilità di smartworking.




Se interessati, inviate il Vostro Curriculum Vitae aggiornato e dettagliato a livia.prettico@atoninformatica.it, che dovrà contenere autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati secondo l'articolo 13 GDPR679/16.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Ti piacerebbe lavorare come Data Engineer nella Direzione IT di BNL?

Entrare a far parte di BNL Gruppo BNP Paribas, significa lavorare in una delle principali banche italiane, parte di un Gruppo internazionale leader europeo nei servizi bancari e finanziari, presente in 64 paesi con circa 184.000 collaboratori.

Significa quindi lavorare in un ambiente sfidante, con una cultura internazionale e fortemente orientato all’innovazione.

Cosa fa la struttura IT Data Platform

La Direzione IT è responsabile funzionalmente delle strutture IT delle società del Gruppo BNL BC e coordina la comunità IT del Gruppo BNPP in Italia con l’obiettivo di ottenere tutte le possibili sinergie di scopo, assicurare piena consistenza operativa ed abilitare la trasformazione digitale del nostro Gruppo

Nell’ambito della Direzione IT di BNL, la Data Platform si occupa di definire ed implementare la strategia tecnologica della Banca in termini di Analytics, Business Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence e Data Management.

Il gruppo ha quindi la responsabilità di evolvere e mantenere operativa l’architettura dati al servizio delle Analytics, nonché di realizzare soluzioni di reporting e dashboarding direzionale.

Il gruppo Data Platform ha anche la responsabilità di costruire soluzioni di Advanced Analytics e Artificial Intelligence, ed integrarle con i sistemi Banca, rendendole pienamente parte dei processi aziendali.

Cosa farai concretamente?

Come Data Engineer farai parte del team “Data Platform” e sarai coinvolto in attività di disegno, implementazione ed evoluzione di soluzioni E2E in ambito Data & Analytics attraverso:

la realizzazione di pipeline di data ingestion e di data preparation
la formalizzazione di scelte tecnologiche, tenendo conto del contesto di applicazione
la modellazione e la gestione end-to-end dei dati a supporto dei processi decisionali
la definizione di KPI e indicatori di monitoraggio dei progetti
il coordinamento dell’analisi e la messa a terra di applicazioni complesse, basate su tecnologie afferenti all’ambito dati che spaziano da piattaforme tradizionali di Datawarehouse ed ETL (DataStage, Teradata, ...), alle tecnologie di Analytics e Reporting (esempio: Microsoft PowerBI, ...), per arrivare fino alle tecnologie di Big Data (Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, ...) e Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (es. Python).
la partecipazione proattiva all’innovazione e all’ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali, anche tramite scouting di tool di mercato legati al mondo Data Science, Data Engineering e Data Governance




Svolgerai queste attività al servizio delle diverse aree di business di BNL, in un contesto dinamico, collaborativo e multidisciplinare e sarai coinvolto anche in iniziative innovative di trasformazione tecnologica, a partire dalle fasi di studio e prototipazione.

Sono certamente apprezzate skill contestuali in ambito Project Management nell’ottica di coordinare le attività del gruppo di lavoro, garantendo la consistenza sia funzionale che tecnica delle soluzioni attraverso una pianificazione puntuale delle milestone in grado di abilitare il delivery on budget, on schedule, on quality.

Il/la candidato/a ideale:

Ha passione per le tematiche legate al mondo Data & Analytics
Ha naturale orientamento all’innovazione ed alla trasformazione
È abile nella capacità di sintesi/semplificazione
Organizza le attività per priorità e gestisce con facilità gli imprevisti
Lavora bene in gruppo in ottica collaborativa

Il/la candidato/a ideale ha alcune delle seguenti competenze:

Conoscenza dei pattern di disegno in ambito architetture dati
Esperienza di guida progettuale significativa in attività afferenti all’ambito dati
Modellazione dati e strumenti di ETL
Conoscenza approfondita del linguaggio SQL
Strumenti di Analisi e Reporting
Conoscenza del Framework Agile, in particolare su metodologia Scrum
Buona conoscenza della Lingua inglese, livello B2




Il background del/la candidato/a ideale:

Ha conseguito la Laurea magistrale in discipline scientifiche
(Ingegneria Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, o similari)
Possibilmente ha 3/5 anni di esperienza in ambito Data & Analytics




La nostra offerta:

Il contratto previsto è a tempo indeterminato, la retribuzione segue quanto previsto dal Contratto Collettivo Nazionale del Credito ed è commisurata al livello di esperienza maturata

Sede di lavoro

Roma in modalità di lavoro ibrida




In un mondo che cambia, la diversità e l'inclusione sono valori fondamentali. BNP Paribas offre pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati idonei e si impegna attivamente a garantire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo in cui tutte le diversità siano valorizzate. Insieme, costruiamo la banca del domani: innovativa, responsabile e sostenibile.

  1. (Ingegneria Informatica, Matematica, Fisica, o similari)

Title: Energy Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Research

Location: Rome, Italy



Description

Joining our Rome Research team, you will play an active role in delivering Aurora's Italian power market forecasts, energy policy analysis and client facing services. In particular, the Analyst will help the development of an Italian power grid model, becoming the expert on grid-related issues for the Italian market. In doing so, you will help to guide utilities, investors, and government through the fundamental transition European power markets are facing.

The successful applicant will combine strong quantitative ability with a track record of performance in team-oriented environments. You will work in a dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. You will enjoy autonomy, the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, and to grow into an industry expert under the guidance of directors with deep experience addressing major strategic issues at the world's leading advisory firms.

The position suits a candidate with 1-2 years of work experience, preferably in positions related to power market modelling. Exact entry position will be dependent on experience and educational level.

We are looking for the candidate to begin the role by March 2025

Key Responsibilities




Carry out quantitative analysis to deliver our power market forecasts and related analysis


Support the development of a grid model for the Italian power system, working closely with our modelling team


Monitor market activity, keeping up to date on the latest market developments


Deliver both online and in-person presentations and workshops to a broad range of client


Work closely with our modelling team, structuring economic problems into quantifiable analyses and deriving insights from the model results


Contribute to Aurora's product development, by identifying new opportunities and expanding our capabilities


Contribute to the expansion of Aurora's research topics and analytical tools




What we are looking for

Required attributes:



Master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Finance)


1-2 years' experience in quantitative analyses is required


Competence in advanced data analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, Matlab, Advanced Excel, SQL, Power BI)


An ability to collect, analyse and interpret complex quantitative data and information


An ability to communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical parties


Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills


A genuine interest in energy economics and the energy transition


Strong teamworking and problem-solving skills


Proficiency (C1 level) in English and Italian



Beneficial attributes:



Existing knowledge or experience in the power sector or a related field


Knowledge of power system simulation tools


Knowledge of the Italian power markets




What we offer




The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector


Direct engagement with clients through Aurora conferences, workshops and webinars


The opportunity to grow into a publicly visible industry expert


A fun, informal, collaborative, and international work culture


A competitive salary package


Access to regular coaching and mentoring sessions and the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals


Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills within the responsibilities of your role and within the wider context of the industry


Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), offering a complete support network that offers expert advice and compassionate guidance 24/7/365, covering a wide range of personal and professional aspects



At Aurora we will consider all requests for flexible working. For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: a hybrid model of remote and in-office working and flexible start and finish times. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility we could offer and we will be happy to explore the best available option for you.

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity.

The successful candidate would start by March 2025. The team will review applications as they are received. Salary will be competitive with experience.

To apply, please submit your Résumé / CV, a personal summary, your salary expectations and please inform us of your notice period.

The successful applicant will combine strong quantitative ability with a track record of performance in team-oriented environments. You will work in a dynamic, intellectually stimulating, and demanding yet supportive environment. You will enjoy autonomy, the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector, and to grow into an industry expert under the guidance of directors with deep experience addressing major strategic issues at the world's leading advisory firms.

The position suits a candidate with 1-2 years of work experience, preferably in positions related to power market modelling. Exact entry position will be dependent on experience and educational level.

We are looking for the candidate to begin the role by March 2025

Key Responsibilities


  • Carry out quantitative analysis to deliver our power market forecasts and related analysis

  • Support the development of a grid model for the Italian power system, working closely with our modelling team

  • Monitor market activity, keeping up to date on the latest market developments

  • Deliver both online and in-person presentations and workshops to a broad range of client

  • Work closely with our modelling team, structuring economic problems into quantifiable analyses and deriving insights from the model results

  • Contribute to Aurora's product development, by identifying new opportunities and expanding our capabilities

  • Contribute to the expansion of Aurora's research topics and analytical tools



What we are looking for

Required attributes:

  • Master's degree in a quantitative subject (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Finance)

  • 1-2 years' experience in quantitative analyses is required

  • Competence in advanced data analytics tools (e.g. Python, R, Matlab, Advanced Excel, SQL, Power BI)

  • An ability to collect, analyse and interpret complex quantitative data and information

  • An ability to communicate and collaborate with both technical and non-technical parties

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills

  • A genuine interest in energy economics and the energy transition

  • Strong teamworking and problem-solving skills

  • Proficiency (C1 level) in English and Italian


Beneficial attributes:

  • Existing knowledge or experience in the power sector or a related field

  • Knowledge of power system simulation tools

  • Knowledge of the Italian power markets



What we offer


  • The opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector

  • Direct engagement with clients through Aurora conferences, workshops and webinars

  • The opportunity to grow into a publicly visible industry expert

  • A fun, informal, collaborative, and international work culture

  • A competitive salary package

  • Access to regular coaching and mentoring sessions and the opportunity to learn from experienced professionals

  • Access to the Aurora Academy, our training programme offering a range of opportunities to develop your skills within the responsibilities of your role and within the wider context of the industry

  • Access to our Employee Assistance Programme (EAP), offering a complete support network that offers expert advice and compassionate guidance 24/7/365, covering a wide range of personal and professional aspects


At Aurora we will consider all requests for flexible working. For most roles, the following types of flexibility are usually possible: a hybrid model of remote and in-office working and flexible start and finish times. Please talk to us during the interview about the flexibility we could offer and we will be happy to explore the best available option for you.

The Company is committed to the principle that no employee or job applicant shall receive unfavourable treatment on grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity.

The successful candidate would start by March 2025. The team will review applications as they are received. Salary will be competitive with experience.

To apply, please submit your Résumé / CV, a personal summary, your salary expectations and please inform us of your notice period.

Title: Data Analyst (ConTe International Academy)
Description:
ConTe.it è il brand italiano del Gruppo Admiral, specializzato in servizi assicurativi semplici, digitali e convenienti.




La sua storia inizia nel 2008 a Roma, con la missione di costruire una realtà assicurativa capace di rispondere alle esigenze degli assicurati: polizze auto a prezzi convenienti e servizio di alta qualità. Tutto nasce da qui, anche il nome, che vuole essere la sintesi della vicinanza, della cura e del servizio.




Da allora ConTe.it non ha smesso di crescere, arrivando a superare in Italia 1 milione di clienti e 600 dipendenti, uniti da un brand riconosciuto in tutto il Paese come campione dell'assistenza e della convenienza.




Innovazione, tecnologia e impiego avanzato e consapevole dei dati sono gli ingredienti che rendono ConTe.it una insurtech di successo con un modello organizzativo agile, flessibile e che valorizza il talento.




Chi cerchiamo?




Siamo alla ricerca di un/una brillante neolaureato/a che voglia partecipare a un progetto sfidante e che stia cercando un’opportunità per lasciare la propria impronta nel business.

Sarai coinvolto in un periodo di training on the job della durata di un anno, durante il quale riceverai feedback periodici attraverso un coaching dedicato.

Nel ruolo di Data Analyst, farai parte del Team Portfolio Analysis e avrai l’opportunità di dare un contributo all’ottimizzazione della selezione del rischio e alla profittabilità del Gruppo Admiral.




Principali responsabilità




Contribuire, in qualità di Data Analyst, all’analisi della struttura tariffaria per supportare la Compagnia assicurativa di riferimento nella creazione di nuovi vantaggi competitivi.
Lavorare su Project Work entrando in contatto diretto con i Senior Manager delle diverse funzioni aziendali.
Conoscere in dettaglio il business del Gruppo Admiral attraverso un affiancamento strutturato.
Acquisire competenze professionali necessarie per una brillante carriera nel business assicurativo.







Must have




Eccellenti risultati accademici preferibilmente con laurea in materie economiche, scientifiche, ingegneristiche.
Inglese fluente (sia scritto che parlato).
Disponibilità di lavoro a tempo pieno.
Disponibilità alla mobilità internazionale.
Potenziale di crescita verso ruoli manageriali.
Completano il profilo spirito di teamwork e orientamento agli obiettivi, spiccate doti analitiche e problem solving, creatività, capacità relazionali.







Sede di lavoro: Roma (Hybrid Model)







Che cosa troverai in ConTe.it




Entrando a far parte della famiglia ConTe.it scoprirai:




Un posto dove poter essere sempre te stesso! Siamo giovani, informali e pensiamo che diversity e inclusione siano valori fondamentali da preservare ed enfatizzare.
La ferma convinzione che le Persone siano più importanti dei processi; non a caso siamo da anni nelle prime posizioni della classifica Great Place to Work® Italia.
Percorsi formativi ricchi e adeguati rispetto alle tue esigenze.
Un New Way of Working all’insegna della flessibilità, in una modalità ibrida che coniughi smart working e il piacere di incontrarci nei nostri uffici di Roma, recentemente rinnovati.
Una serie di benefits (Sconti dedicati, programmi di welfare e wellbeing) per consentire il giusto equilibrio vita-lavoro.
Un ambiente di lavoro internazionale, grazie alla collaborazione e condivisione con i nostri colleghi della famiglia Admiral che si trovano in Spagna, Francia, UK, USA, Canada e India.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
QIBIT, divisione ICT di Gi Group S.p.A., Agenzia per il Lavoro (Aut. Min. 26/11/04 Prot. n. 1101-SG), è specializzata nella selezione, formazione, inserimento e sviluppo professionale dei profili IT per il mercato italiano.

Per importantissima società italiana del settore della distribuzione elettrica ed energetica, operante in ambito nazionale ed internazionale, stabile, strutturata e dotata di tecnologie ed organizzazione all’avanguardia, Gigroup attraverso QiBit ricerca:




BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE SPECIALIST




La risorsa individuata farà parte di un nuovo team giovane ed in forte crescita, focalizzato sullo sviluppo soluzioni di BI all’avanguardia interne, e si occuperà del monitoraggio dei dati resi disponibili da sensoristica distribuita IoT, Data Management a partire dai processi di Asset Management, sviluppo di dashboard in PowerBI e data visualization in generale, interfaccia e supporto operativo da remoto per le unità operative, supporto analitico alla flotta elicotteri e droni.




Requisiti:

- 2-3 anni di esperienza nel ruolo (idealmente nell’ambito energetico)

- Laurea magistrale in Ingegneria Automazione, Matematica, Informatica, Statistica o altre discipline STEM

- Conoscenze approfondite di statistica, matematica, coding e data visualization

- Buona conoscenza di PowerBI, Excel, Phyton;

- Competenze in ambito Business Intelligence e di utilizzo di PowerBI per creazione report e dashboard

- Spiccata attitudine analitica e di problem solving;

- Buona padronanza della lingua inglese (B1);




Sede/Modalità di lavoro: Roma (zona Pietralata). Sono presenti navette della società che portano dal centro alla sede di lavoro; in alternativa è anche possibile lavorare presso altre sedi della società in zona Termini o San Paolo. Smartworking flessibile. Orario di lavoro 9-18.

Offerta/Prospettive: Assunzione a tempo indeterminato diretta da parte dell’azienda cliente. Ottimo inquadramento contrattuale e retribuzione, ottime prospettive di crescita e carriera interne, formazione e performance appraisal annuali, piani formativi ed academy interne, premi di produzione




Per maggiori informazioni sulla divisione QiBit visitare il sito www.qibit.it




-----------------------------------------------------------------------




Facciamo parte di Gi Group Holding (www.gigroupholding.it) la prima multinazionale italiana del lavoro e una tra le principali realtà che offrono servizi e consulenza HR a livello globale. Il nostro Gruppo è attivo nei seguenti campi: Temporary, Permanent e Professional Staffing, Ricerca e Selezione di Profili Manageriali, Executive Search, Outsourcing, Formazione, Consulenza HR, Amministrazione HR, Employability, Transizione e Sviluppo di Carriera. Siamo presenti in più di 37 Paesi in Europa, Asia e America con un team di oltre 9.000 persone.

I valori che ci contraddistinguono: attenzione, collaborazione, passione, sostenibilità, apprendimento continuo e innovazione, responsabilità.

Consulta tutti i nostri annunci su www.gigroup.it




Gi Group S.p.A. è autorizzata ad operare dal Ministero del Lavoro e delle Politiche Sociali (Aut. Min. 26/11/2004 PROT. 1101 - SG).

L’offerta si intende rivolta ai candidati nel rispetto del D.lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 e n. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento.

I candidati sono invitati a leggere l’informativa privacy ai sensi degli artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. EU 679/2016 al seguente indirizzo www.gigroup.it/privacy-candidati

Title: Data Analytics Specialist
Description:
DATA ANALYTICS SPECIALIST

We are seeking a dynamic Data Analytics Specialist to join our Business Analytics Team. This role will be in charge of collecting and processing large datasets to uncover valuable insights that drive business decisions. This role involves using ETL tools, statistical methods and data visualization techniques to interpret complex data and present findings to stakeholders.

Focus Areas:

Data Manipulation and Cleaning: Gather data from various sources, build and integrate automated workflows, ensure data quality

Data Visualization: Create visual representations of data findings using automated and dynamic dashboards to make data easily understandable; optimize and / or redesign the existing ones

Data Analysis: Use statistical methods and software tools to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and correlations

Performance Monitoring: Develop automated workflows for target setting and monitoring

Collaboration: Work closely with Business Analytics team and Business Units to understand data needs and provide data-driven solutions

Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices in data analytics.

Qualifications:

Education:
Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience:
>2 years in Data Analytics
Proven track record of successful projects execution
Skills:
Proficiency in Excel, Python, SQL, ETL (Alteryx, Knime), Power BI
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure)


About Zoetis

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.





Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities, and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.




Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more here.
